data.title: Southeast Edmonton Homes For Sale
data.meta_description: If you’re interested in any of our new homes for sale in Southeast Edmonton, we encourage you to reach out. Browse our newly built homes!
data.text:
Families with children will benefit from its high density of schools and parks. And working parents who have to travel frequently have an added advantage, with its proximity to the Edmonton International Airport. Moreover, it boasts a ton of accessible amenities pertaining to entertainment, retail, plus shopping malls, restaurants, and cinema theatres. There’s so much to do!

You’l also find many healthcare institute options, making it one of the most convenient as well as appealing locations for family members of all ages.

Sterling Homes offers an affordable way to join this family-centred lifestyle area, with plenty of new communities. There’s a large range of new homes in Southeast Edmonton – most of which are front garage houses on large lots.

For those of you looking for lots for sale in Edmonton Southeast to build a home, consider our new houses for sale in Edmonton Southeast instead. Sterling Homes not only purchases high-value lots in carefully chosen neighbourhoods, but also builds homes of extraordinary quality. We are so confident in our quality and so committed to meeting your housing needs that all our new homes for sale in Southeast Edmonton or anywhere else for that matter, come with a 10-year warranty and an outstanding follow-up service.

Take a tour of one of our showhomes in this area to get an idea of what your life could be like.

Preferred Home Builder in Edmonton

A family-owned corporation, Sterling Homes has been building homes for over 65 years in Western Canada. Our mission is to make quality homes available at affordable prices and we have demonstrated such expertise that we’re consistently one of the best-selling, move-up home providers in Edmonton.

In addition we are a Qualico company that has been awarded the consumer choice award in 2020 for best homes in Alberta. We continue to build homes in greater Edmonton’s finest family communities. Our proven ability to build high-quality homes at affordable rates has contributed to our superior market position as one of the most preferred builders in Alberta.

By employing volume purchasing power for materials, trades, and land, we’ve consistently been able to realize our mission of making well-built homes available at reasonable prices.

Furthermore, we construct quality homes from the ground up in carefully chosen communities where people prefer to live. Naturally, our new homes in Southeast Edmonton live up to the promise, not only in terms of the exceptional design and construction materials but also the beautiful neighborhoods with first-class amenities.

Sterling Homes’ Edmonton Southeast homes for sale include townhomes, duplexes, laned homes, and front attached garage homes.

Sterling Homes

Whether you’re a first-time buyer, move-up buyer, or a down-size buyer, we have the perfect home to match your specific requirements, with a variety of home styles and floor plans and as many as 53 model designs. Take your pick from a broad variety of newly built homes and move in, in as little as 30, 60, or 90 days.

What’s more, our dedication to exceeding customer expectations even continues long after you’ve moved into your home in Southeast Edmonton. Our superior follow-up service coupled with our ability to provide top-notch homes in a timely and affordable manner has helped us widen our customer base to the point that a majority of our prospective clients are referred by happy and satisfied customers.

We select building materials and products adhering to the highest benchmarks, so all our new homes in Southeast Edmonton or at any other location are fortified with the strongest, quality conscious, and energy-efficient materials. We focus on style as well as functionality so customers don’t have to compromise between the two. Who says you can’t have both?

If you’re looking to find a high-quality home that meets your requirements, browse our new, inspiring, and modern home designs that you’ll continue to be proud of, for many years to come.

Our 10-year home warranty, with its completion guarantee and a new home warranty “excellent” rating, ensures that!

Southeast Edmonton Communities

Have you been exploring communities throughout the Edmonton area to find the one that’s right for you? It’s time to check out the Southeast Edmonton area! As a developing area, you’ll find that prices here tend to be a bit more affordable, but you’re not skimping out on amenities. The communities Sterling builds in this area are close to the things you need, and many have additional features you might not have thought about.

Explore our Southeast Edmonton communities to find the neighbourhood that’s best for you.

Aster

Aster is a brand-new community in the southeast part of Edmonton. You’ll have your pick of available lots, and you’ll be able to shape the community from the beginning.Aster has the perfect location. It’s inside the perimeter, so you get to enjoy all the advantages of feeling like you live in an urban setting while still having the natural setting you’ve been looking for. It’s bounded by Anthony Henday, so it’s going to be incredibly easy for you to get from your home to the highway. Since this major road takes you anywhere in Edmonton, this is a big plus.

You’ll also find that it’s easy to get to the amenities you need. Even though Aster is a brand-new community that will be under construction for the next few years, it’s right next to areas that are already developed. In fact, it’s right across the street from Tamarack Common, and you’re just a short drive away from popular stores like Sobey’s Garden Market and Home Depot.

Laurel Crossing

Laurel Crossing is an excellent choice for families. The community features a storm pond, several parks, and a playground area. Kids will have no trouble getting outside and staying active. There’s also a school planned for the future, which will be close enough for the kids to walk.

The Laurel Crossing neighbourhood also features many different styles of homes, including townhomes, duplex homes, and front attached homes. You can choose the style that best meets your needs.

For a bit of extra fun, you can choose between the Meadows Recreation Centre and the Millwoods Recreation Centre. Both are nearby and offer similar, yet slightly different features. Residents of Laurel Crossing also enjoy going to the Mill Woods Golf Course to play a few rounds.

The proximity to Mill Woods Town Centre and the Rio-Can Shopping Centre makes it easy to shop for the essentials. With plenty of restaurants and coffee shops around, you won’t have any trouble picking up dinner on the way home from work or meeting some friends for a mid-day pick-me-up.

Laurel Crossing is also conveniently located for commuters. It’s also just 20 minutes to the downtown area, and easy to get anywhere else in the city via the Anthony Henday.

Southeast Edmonton Amenities

You want your home to have easy access to a variety of things that will make your life more comfortable. Naturally, you’re probably looking for things like playgrounds and walking trails right in your community, but you also want the convenience of having things like restaurants and stores within a short driving distance.

At Sterling, we understand this need. That’s why we choose to build in communities that are close to the amenities you want. Our communities in the Southeast Edmonton area offer residents everything they need for a happy life, such as the things you see listed below.

Plenty of Shopping

Perhaps nothing is more important than having the right stores nearby. You want to be able to easily pick up something you need on the way home from work. The communities of Laurel Crossing and Aster are in the centre of it all, so you’ll be able to get to most stores in about five or 10 minutes. For instance, at Tamarack Common, you’ll find a number of national retailers, such as PetSmart, Save-On-Foods, HomeSense, Winners, as well as restaurants such as Joey’s, Boston Pizza and A&W. South Edmonton Common is another popular shopping destination featuring a plethora of great amenities.

Parks and Rec to Stay Fit

If you’re looking for a place to work out or have some fun with the family, the Meadows Recreation Centre and the Mill Woods Recreation Centre are great choices. In fact, those who live in Aster or Laurel Crossing can even walk to the Meadows Rec Centre. It’s just across the street. Both of these locations offer things like exercise machines, group fitness classes, swimming pools and ice skating rinks. No matter how you like to stay fit, you’ll be able to do it at one of these two locations.

Want to get outside instead? The Mill Woods Sports Park is just next to the rec centre. It has a small lake, sports fields, and a water park that’s open during the summer. It’s a great place to cool off with the kids. The Jackie Parker park is also in the Southeast Edmonton area, and it offers a lot of unique things, such as a fire ring for campfires (summer only) and winterized picnic areas.

Health Services

When you’re feeling sick, you don’t want to have to travel far to get to the doctor. Most people who live in Southeast Edmonton use Grey Nuns Hospital when they need a hospital. There’s also the Summerside Medical Clinic and Mill Woods Public Health — along with a number of smaller private health facilities.

Pets can stay healthy as well, with regular check-ups at places like the Summerside Vet Hospital.

Feeling Hungry?

Looking for a nice bite to eat? You’ll certainly have plenty of choices. In suburban areas like this, there’s never a lack of popular fast food and fast-casual restaurants, like Denny’s or DQ Grill and Chill. Of course, if you’re looking for something a little nicer, you could check out Brown’s Social House Tamarack. This is a great restaurant for after-work drinks, get-togethers with friends, or date nights. There are also a number of Indian restaurants in this area. In the Summerside area, check out The Workshop Eatery, which offers farm-to-table delicacies.

Easy Commuting

Residents of Southeast Edmonton find it easy to get around the city. The Anthony Henday and Whitemud Drive are close by, and it takes less than 30 minutes to get to the downtown area by car. The airport is also close. However, many people these days are interested in travelling by public transportation. You’ll be happy to know there are plenty of bus stops within walking distance of the communities we build in, and most routes can take you into the downtown area in about an hour. While there are no current plans for an LRT stop, we can hope that the increasing popularity of the Southeast Edmonton area will drive a need for one in the future.
